posts.sub: My inner voice is almost completely disappeared
posts.com:
I used to get lost in my thoughts and daydreams. I used to fantasize, plan, speak eloquently and thoughtfully, make theories and observations around my surroundings, and converse with myself. In the past 4-5 years my inner voice has been disappearing. I find myself reacting emotionally (almost "reflexively") to things rather than thoughtfully as I once did. I don't read as much as I used to, and when I do it isn't the same. I no longer find joy in "debating" people and just lash out at people vitriolically when I think they're wrong about something. I couldn't even if I tried, I feel like I'm not capable of understanding and responding to things anymore without great mental strain.

I don't think I have an "inner voice" anymore, I just kind of "do whatever I want" at any given time without verbalizing anything internally or contemplating. I am addicted to coffee and nicotine and I am almost constantly either drinking coffee or smoking. Sometimes when I'm forced to do any type of work my mind just turns off and I have to exert extreme mental strain to just comprehend a simple concept and execute a thought.

I think my soul might be dead, or someone flicked a switch to limit computing power on my qualia. Is there a spiritual explanation? How do I combat soul death?

I did not have two distinct "voices" with different characteristics Now that you've made me think about it, it was more like having two selves, one "actual" (that I identify with) and one "inner," if that makes sense. It always felt like I was conversing with a secondary "self," an inner one. He was simultaneously more sensitive, afraid, thoughtful, logical, emotional et cetera at the same time. My attachment to this inner self almost felt like I was looking out for another person at times and vice versa. I feel now that I have lost this partner. The funny thing is I know exactly what you mean about the location of the conscience, while I give thought to morality, whenever I do something that violates my own conscience, I physically feel it around the nape of my neck and the upper and lower parts of where the spine meets the skull.
>Has it been an improvement or detriment?
A great detriment - I am not even able to focus my eyes anymore at times, and at times I find myself thinking about quite literally nothing, like static inside my brain. I feel like my decisionmaking, planning, executive functioning and inhibitory control have all degraded into nothing.
>Are/were you on a 'spiritual journey'?
I have always felt adrift. I dabbled in existential philosophy, and esotericism, and conventional religion, and my own belief systems at different times. Now I pretty much believe in nothing and everything - which I feel is another symptom of my soul death, an interminable ennui and boredom from the search.

posts.com:
We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.
Last thread: >>33823735

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
A collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

>>33950692
>>33950849
The arisal of chaos from the dyad can be explained in two ways.

First, you can identify chaos with inconstancy, i.e. with Mercury in the alchemical triad of Sulphur, Mercury, and Salt. Then the dyad of Sulphur-Salt gives rise to the mediating principle of Mercury.

Second, you can apply the dyad to itself to produce the tetrad of the four elements. You can then call the mixture of these four elements "chaos". Here, chaos has a meaning similar to "matter" or "material existence". Ramon Llull's Liber Chaos goes deeper into this view.

So when you say
>The wall socket is female, then plug is male, and the union of both allows for the flow of electricity.
This is exactly correct. The wall socket is Salt, the plug is Sulphur, together they create Mercury corresponding to the "flow of electricity".

But I agree with Ape that that diagram is going in my list of "top 10 most confused, broken messes of a system I've ever seen". The sooner you scrub it from your memory the better. The patterns you're seeing are true, but the diagram is nonsense.

>We are speculating without having any real sense of what the angelic Terms of Service even were.
My pet theory about that is that "Heaven" itself is a florid elaboration on the concept of the family unit.
There are strong psychological and emotional bonds within a family that don't exist between random strangers, or if they do, they are painfully earned rather than instinctive.
Now, combine that with centuries of people trying to come to grips with "society", while all manner of characters are attempting to make heads-or-tails out of whatever "dreams" are supposed to be, and it's not hard to picture where all manner of "mythologies" and their dream-like logic might have originated.

Something that stuck with me for a long time about "the God of the Isrealites" was mentioned by a guy I knew who wasn't even necessarily a believer. He said a core tenet of God's "covenant" with mankind is seen early on with Moses and delivering the Jews from bondage in Egypt -- chosen not because they were "the best of us" but to demonstrate his ability and willingness to uplift even the lowest of us, if only we commit to living righteously in his eyes.
Like I said, that point stuck with me for a long time, even moreso than all the many Bible verses power-injected into my brain as a kid.

I can tell you what the presence of God feels like.

Nothing love, joy, warmth and truly being freed. All of the suffering and pain is wiped away in his presence. Every disparing, anxiety, suffering just gone. It was the most profound moment of my life, I have taken LSD and Psilocybin and they do not compare, it's something so much more than you can imagine, you can only understand when you experiance it.

For context, I accepted Christ after a decade of being an atheist and feeling quite strongly I could never believe in God or anything but the 'scientific' worldview.

I saw something that completely shattered this view, which is what set the ball in motion. After I accepted Christ I took a literal leap of faith and agreed to be baptized.

I'd never been at a baptism ceremony, did not know what to expect or how I should feel. Never heard the testimony of those who were baptized before, I went in essentially blind and quite nervous.

As I received the instructions to be plunged, covering this and that, I had a powerful presence overcome me. A few seconds later I was plunged into the water and boom, gone. I came up and several people were crying, even my own sibling who was and is not a believer.

The people who ran the ceremony for the church that day noted this presence as well, it wasn't just within me but in the room with us.

If I had not been held up during this encounter I would have buckled at my knees no doubt. When I closed my eyes to go under I saw nothing but Light instead of the usual darkness. I felt truly freed, refreshed, reborn.

I've made so many mistakes since then, I truly do not feel worthy of the experiance God gave me, but I have it nonetheless. One might say that they have faith God is real, I get to say I know He is.

As cliche as it is, all it takes if faith. Faith in the higher, faith in Love, faith in family and all that is right. Faith in God, faith in a better future for all of us. I have faith that you too can make it

Dude in the US who appeared in your front door with a giant check saying you won the national lottery, it had tons of ads in America to get people to play the lottery, the guy supposedly gave the prizes himself once in a while as part of his job. In Moonraker, one of the James Bond's most famous movies, a returning villain-turned-antihero Jaws (who is somewhat ugly) gets to fight alongside a good-looking girl and in the end, as the visual gag/plot twist, she smiles at him to express her feelings towards the guy while at the same time showing she had massive braces hence the empathy, she didn't care Jaws had metal teeth because she had them too. Supposedly she never had braces thus leaving the focus on her smile in that close-up scene to be quite empty in meaning; the 007 forums one day went haywire when most of their members realized they had it all "wrong", was somewhat a big thing here too when word reached. >>33957438
Technically yes, although it is questionable to how powerful or advantageous a mind upload would be.
We do not have any exact numbers or idea but is generally assumed that the brain has a vast capacity for data storage much larger than your average server or computer.
But except for the fact that you are not constricted by ageing, I do not really see a great advantage, I'd rather see it as tying yourself down as a measure of last resort to a large complicated and immobile infrastructure.
The transfer of your consciousness to another location will not be a quick process, now an alternative might be to have it work like a distributed system, with multiple copies of yourself accessing a database and handling the resource load.
Or alternatively having just multiple uploaded copies of you roam around, but there is no reason why these different copies, depending on the personality, might not just compete with each other.
So another option might be having a bunch of sleeping copies which you could activate once the current running copy has a failure for some reason, although that also requires some way of classifying when an uploaded consciousness has died, which might be difficult depending on how the consciousness is set up and distributed.
And there is always the issue of possible file corruption or just incrementally increasing mistakes in your data over time.

Copernicus by telling us we were not at the center of the universe, Darwin by telling us we weren't different from animals, that what we considered our consciousness was just an accident in evolution.

We'll stop having any purpose, memory, dream, just desires, like a newborn, screaming for milk and warmth.
The only escape from this hell will be the AI being tired of our babbles and going to buy smokes in another galaxy, to see if he can't find another omniscient entity to hang around with.

>>33944840
You're not going to find him in Hindi mythology under that specific name due to the east-west divide, along with the fact that we've lost a ton of history, especially in the middle east since Jews, Christians and Muslims destroyed it all.
With that said, the story of Kaal Bhairav mirrors the Luciferic story in some ways.
>Brahma who in many traditions is considered the creator God lies to Lord Shiva
>Lord Shiva is angered over his hypocrisy so "rebels" by cutting off one of his heads.
>He's cast down to the earth and becomes Kaal Bhairav, sometimes referred to as "the dark one".
It doesn't seem too dissimilar to the Lucifer mythos as "the prince of darkness", at least archetypically speaking.
I also believe there's a connection to the earliest known manifestation of the morning star known as Attar and Shiva as Rudra, at least symbolically.
>Attar's symbol is the antelope, a horned animal
>Shiva/Rudras symbol is the Bull, another horned animal.
>Attar carries a spear
>Shiva/Rudra carries a trident
>Attar is a God of storms, fertility and war
>Shiva/Rudra is a God of storms fertility and the hunt
You also have the serpent symbolism associated with both Lucifer and Shiva, Lucifer as the serpent in the Garden of Eden, Shiva as being associated with the serpent as he has a serpent around his neck.
The Gnostics also believed that the God Abraxas (A Shiva like figure) was equivalent to the serpent in the garden of eden (or the Lucifer).
When we look at these things in an archetypical fashion, without limiting ourselves to a single "lense" or dogma, it appears there may be a strong connection there between the two.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33951965
>History surely has left us to a wide array of potential possibilities and interpretations. As a Westerner, I struggle to grasp how diverse Indian spiritual culture is.

Well, Hinduism can't really be classified as a singular religion per se, since each community might venerate a different God in a different way. When you consider you have thousands of villages in India that each has their own traditions and ways of doing things, that essentially means there's no one "singular" Hinduism. Unlike say in Catholicism where everything is centralized.

> am most familiar with nondual Shaiva Tantra in which Shiva is treated as the all encompassing Pure Consciousness.

Technically it's faceless but also contains all faces. In reality it probably shouldn't even be named, because to name it doesn't quite give it enough credit as anything we name it also does not do it full justice.

With Shiva, to understand his mysteries, especially in comparative mythology, one has to learn to separate the archetype [or the God as a person, whom we've applied our own ideas to and anthropomorphized] from the general concept.

To me, Shiva, as the "Blue God" is what represents this greater concept but in a capacity we can understand and interact with without driving ourselves insane, but unfortunately we can never fully understand this greater concept outside of the archetypes we create for it because our minds simply aren't equipped to handle such paradoxes.

We create the archetypes or "faces" so we can interact with these cosmic ideas in a way we can understand, especially since it's kind of hard to interact with that which is not without at least contextualizing it in a way we can understand.

It's ironic because even Lord Shiva, is an aspect of Shiva as the concept of the all, as it's names are infinite, as are it's attributes, it simply filters and is understood differently depending upon the culture which venerates it and the characteristics the culture applies to it.

-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Lucid dreaming is lame. It ruined dreaming for me for years. I started attempting to do it when I was about 17 because it sounded cool and I was good at it. Too good. Turns out no matter what every single dream would go lucid as I realised I was dreaming. Countless interesting dreams ruined so I could become aware for a minute or so, fly around a bit and then wake up. This went on for years. I'm 34 now and the last couple of years I've had quite a few dreams that have been normal, interesting, good. I'm happy with that. In fact it's been a while since I had a lucid one.
I also had many sleep paralysis and once you get over them they're actually kind of cool. I've had some really incredible moments of hallucination whilst paralysed. They're always bad, though, always without fail. I've thought my house was burning down and I could hear my mum screaming for help. I've been in an explosion and I physically felt my body get flung from the couch I was sleep on into the ceiling before hitting the ground, I've heard demonic whispers and had something watching me.
The scariest one by a long, long way was I felt myself being sucked into my bed and it became apparent that I was being sucked into hell. I could feel my body being dragged down hard and the bed became oppresively hot. There was a distant sound of screaming and I was overcome with an incredibly intense fear. I always end up wrenching myself out of these experiences all of a sudden but with this one I literally had to tear myself away from the bed with every ounce of strength I could muster and I genuinely screamed whilst doing so. I found myself sat bolt upright, breathing heavily, drenched in sweat with my heart slamming itself against my ribs.
If I didn't understand what sleep paralysis was at that moment I would have been deeply affected by that.

To improve your chances of lucid dreaming, try going to bed when you're very tired and feeling like you could fall asleep instantly. When you wake up in the middle of the night, avoid going back to bed right away. Instead, get up and do something like walking around your room or getting a glass of water. When you go back to bed, focus on the sensation of your body falling asleep and try to be aware of the process. As you start to fall asleep, you may begin to feel a vibration throughout your body. At this point, it's important to stay calm and not get too excited as this could cause you to wake up. Remember, the key is to be calm and concentrated. Lucid dreaming can be difficult to master, but the potential for creating vivid and lifelike dreamscapes is worth the effort.

The potential benefits of lucid dreaming are vast and varied. With the ability to control and manipulate dream scenarios, individuals can use this skill to enhance creativity, problem-solve, and even work through unresolved emotional issues. With proper training, the potential uses for lucid dreaming are limitless, and one can imagine the impact it could have on society if more people had the ability to harness this powerful tool.

I had a routine where every other Sunday night, I'd do some DCK and play Red Dead. With my work schedule, school, and other obligations, I had no time to ever do it and have the next day off to recover and also had no time to game. So on these Sundays, it actually felt like transferring my consciousness into another reality. From start to finish with the Red Dead story, I was on DCK. I was not playing the game. I was Arthur Morgan, and these camp followers were my family. There was no distinction between me and the game world except whenever my controller would die and snap me back into reality.

I have not played a video game since this, because no gaming experience will ever top the profound immersion I experienced doing this with this game.

tl;dr: I love Ketamine.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Well there are many forms of anxiety, the difference being what worries you. Anxiety is basically unreasonable and disproportionate fear of something.
If multiple social situations (or thoughts about them) make you uneasy, it could be social anxiety.
If you are afraid of places that are hard to escape from, agoraphobia.
If you have intense episodes of anxiety, with fear of them happening again, panic disorder.
If you worry about most events in your life, generalized anxiety.
If you are afraid that your personality might be disintegrating, dissolving or vanishing, psychotic anxiety and so on.
There are more forms of it but you get the idea.
Most of them are the result many different factors that i dont want to get into (low self-esteem, family problems, genetics, bad experiences and so on), but mostly keep happening because of thoughts that are illogical in some way, but appear as true on the first glance. That happens because of the innate feeling of correctness that comes with all thoughts and beliefs.
Most thoughts are automatic, so when you start feeling anxious, you can try to identify thoughts and beliefs about that situation that make you anxious and try to give yourself alternative interpretations of the event.
An example - if you are afraid of going to a bar and you think that people there will look at you, talk bad about you or think you are clumsy or something - remember that people forget faces all the time, that they are more concerned about themselves then you, that they dont know as much about you as you do, that they wont notice all the things you are feeling and so on.
After that its good to test your new thoughts about it, so that you can see that they are correct, by going to the bar.
This doesn't apply to psychotic anxiety, that's a different beast.
Gl and its okay to ask for help if you can't overcome it on your own.

>>33930658
>no one has an actual explanation yet
Color theory has an explanation for this. It's that the cones of the eyes change shape depending of the lightness of the room. If you are in a dark room, and go outside, everything gets too bright, you have to adjust. If you come from a light place to a dark one, you see nothing, you have to adjust.
That's it, the cones tell the brain that the lightest color they can see it's white, screens are actually light cyan, if you could compare them with light in the outside, you'd see how dim they look, the white in your screen isn't white.
And that's it, people on their lives have some adjustment to see colors as white, if they come from a screen, they'll see the dress is white too.
If not, the dress will look blue. The other color depends on what is "white."
You can try it yourself with software like Powerstrip, move the temperature slider to the right for a yellower white, or to the left for blue. At first whites look very dark, but as you get used to it, you can see the dress is white or it's blue depending on what you adjust to, and the other one always looks darker (once you set on a white, whatever is not white is darker, lightness/darkness is relative.)

You can be quite independent, orderly, persistant, methodical, idealistic, have good intuition. You are often nervous and can have doubts on yourself. You might feel like your emotional security is tied to your achievements in life and you can be sensitive to being criticized by others.
In your childhood, you experienced wounds regarding to your close relationships. You were often alone and probably felt like the only person you could rely on was only yourself. Often, you felt unwanted or that you weren't being good enough to others. You fear being rejected and abandoned, so you avoid relationships altogether in order to protect yourself from getting hurt. However, what you're meant to do is to trust that other people will help you grow as an individual. Learning how to broaden your view on others, to move past your wounds, to commit or engage with other people and to relationships, will be an important factor in helping yourself spiritually in this life. Balancing yourself with others will be important. Things will be very difficult, but once you learn to this, life will become much more fulfilling to you.

Hmm, I thought you were alluding to oppositions. I don't think what you're saying is correct. A planet being in its domicile isn't far behind from being as positive as when it falls in its exaltation and having many planets in the signs they rule obviously can make the chart much less unified in some sense but it's very beneficial nonetheless. There's clearly good things to the kind of homogenous chart you're referring to but many bad as well. Harmony's way more important.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33946909
>I thought you were alluding to oppositions
It goes without saying that's part of it.
>A planet being in its domicile isn't far behind from being as positive
A domicile is simply the full expression, for both good and ill. Reaping all the benefits of a planet's nature, but also being saddled with every one of its negative traits. The exaltation is the placement which eschews the burden of these vices inherent to the planet, so that it is expressd virtually wholly positively.

>having many planets in the signs they rule obviously can make the chart much less unified in some sense
Yes. If you were to have an individual with every single domicile placement, you would not have a superman, and one would still be fortunate to come out a well-adjusted individual considering all the disparate placements it entails.
The incoherence as I have termed it creates internal conflicts which interferes with the expression of certain planets and signs in favor of others, and that suppression results in repression, which usually doesn't go well.

One of course must pay attention to how the signs aspect each other, and that will determine whether the energies work together or against each other, with sextiles, semi-sextiles, and trines being of a harmonious nature---but natives would generally like their chart to look one-sided, and leave the other half empty.

>Stelliums, while sometimes positive in some ways, can have major drawbacks to them
Not really. You do get more of the unfiltered vices of a sign becoming expressed, but they are never of a contradictory nature such that prognosis and treatment requires any complex diagnosis, an untangling of too subtly imbalanced energies. With incoherent charts, the reader finds that they "don't even know where to start", or what advice to give, as all such configurations are essentially novel.
A stellium---is uncomplicated.

>>33947443
Something for you to consider is how we all face the immediate threat of our mortality. When we place ourselves at Death's door, our survival instincts are called into question, and the core of ourselves which is our will to live is exposed and laid bare. It is of the id, the most primitive part of the human psyche, dictating the way in which we live our lives and experience the world.

Until we have put ourselves into that mentality, we live in many illusions and delusions as to what we value or believe. One who sees life as devoid of meaning may find their life and the world not so worthless after all, if their most fervent wish in such a moment is after all self-preservation. And when one realizes that they would rather live than not, suddenly, they come to see too how they would rather live in a certain "place" so to speak than others---meaning, surrounded and immersed in an artificial world pleasing to their own senses. And it is one thing to accouter one's life with the adornments designed by others---but another thing to find this subtly dissatisfactory, and moved to create oneself. That is the essence of art, one's own contribution to the "illusions" of human life.

We do things to make our living more comfortable. Culinary, musical, fashionable, visual, there are many realms for one's creativity to be applied. You must simply find where she'd care to customize. And this is discovered by imagining that realm bleak and barren, helpless---and coming back to reality, perspective realigned.

>>33956506
If you want to start learning how to read charts first learn what all the planets mean. Then learn how each planet behaves in different signs. Ascendant included. A very basic example is that you have Moon and venus in Cancer, which means that you are very emotional and a romantic person. You fall in love like people do in the movies and books.
So after you get acquainted with how planets behave in different signs, start learning about aspects (red blue lines between different planets) and what kind of effect they bring. So although you have a very sensitive internal mind, you are also extremely aggressive and upfront with how you deal with conflict (Aries Mars). Like the charging ram you rush into conflict. This means you have a great conflict there (Moon square Mars) which will probably cause trouble for you and people around you. Learning the aspects will take considerable amount of time. Practice on yourself and the people you know well.
After this start getting acquainted with the houses.
If you want to actually be an expert in astrology and not stay a surface level plebian who reduces the stars into mere psychology, you should look into to the traditional hellenistic school. It's all very much real.

>>33951310
>Is it wrong to not be vegan? Immoral? Bad karma?
The same way having sex before marriage is immoral. Ideally, all men and women would abstain from sex until settling down with a single, monogamous partner for the rest of their lives, the union of which is defined by marriage. It is unreasonable, however, to expect all humans to abide by this. Still, an objective moral standard needs to be set.

Whether veganism is or should be this standard, I am on the fence about. It should be noted that Orthodox Christian monastics practice a "vegan" diet (i.e. no meat or dairy products) through fasting. I am convinced, however, that children and adolescents need animal proteins and fats to sustain their human growth and development.

Lots of modern day vegans are proponents of processed substitutions of various animal foods (vegan cheese, various types of milk, etc.) without realizing the environmental destruction the creation of which causes. The amount of plastic, manufacturing, etc. far outweighs the natural, symbiotic detriments of traditional animal farming. I reckon no Orthodox monastery would serve its constituents or guests these types of foods.

Meat consumption in the West is greedy, decadent, and wasteful, to say the least. I've adopted a predominantly pescatarian diet (incl. chicken), reserving steaks and red meat for special occasions, and have never felt better or more comfortable with my relationship to food. Most people could probably benefit from a similar diet, or at the very least, adopting a more sacred relationship with meat like how the Native Americans would utilize the whole of every animal they killed.

IMO if you are in a guest-like situation where someone serves you meat or dairy, it is rude to refuse on the basis of "muh politics" or "muh ego"

I'm not gonna takfir all Sufis but yeah, they sometimes have problems. Not exclusive to Sufis tho, you can find Salafis with wild takes as well and Sufis are a lot closer to orthodox Islam than they've been portrayed as in the West (and there are various ulterior motives behind that misrepresentation). But it's something to be careful with imo even if you're looking into a legit tariqa or listening to a legit sheikh. My advice is to disregard all Western sources on the topic and start with Imam al-Ghazali. He at least, and probably many Sufi greats, is much more focused on stuff like taqwa and dhikr than on uncovering secrets.

I'm not gonna do tafsir on that passage and it's a very dangerous thing to do without knowledge, which I don't have. Just a warning in case it ever applies to you, al-Qurtubi said that it's kufr even if your interpretation is correct, at least for public interpretation. But yeah, I share your concerns. I think this attitude of beelining straight for mystic knowledge is really unhealthy, not that that's what all or even most Sufis do. It's intellectually gluttonous, the equivalent of only wanting to eat exciting food at every meal, health be damned. Which is why it shouldn't surprise us that it's the aspect of Islam that elicits the most interest and sympathy in the West, Western culture is gluttonous in every sense.

We should focus on doing the basics excellently, following the law and sunnah, purifying our hearts and drawing closer to God. If that ends with God giving us some hidden wisdom then so be it, icing on the cake. If not, is our goal to fill our heads woth esoteric information or to escape Hell, attain Paradise, and become close to God for His own sake?

>It makes me wonder if they did see the future or if they dreamt it and made it happen. Both are equally possible in my eyes.
Biblically speaking, our physical "present" is technically the past. God is "I AM", meaning that those in the spiritual plane are in the "now", the present moment, which is why we in the physical experience can predict and manifest things, because we're in a state of time that's lagging behind before true events have happened.

If you need a scientific point of view, just think about how your senses can't detect things instantaneously. When you see something, light has to travel through your eyes, then send signals to your brain, then the brain processes that information. Same goes for sound, which has to travel as waves to your ears, then into the ear drums, and so on. When you touch something, the sensation has to go through your nerves, then be registered by your brain, and so on and so forth for taste and smell too. You never really experience the present moment in the physical world.

>For someone that tries so hard I really am terrible at this
Don't blame yourself Anon, it can be really hard when things are falling apart around you to do this. Having been in similar situations until my manifestations came it I would suggest a couple of steps:

1. Continue working on your main working until you feel it "set." Once it is set you need to let it work and get out of the way.
2. Do other workings to support it- things like "everything is going well/I am supported and well"
3. When 3d is getting overwhelming simply believe in your workings and that everything turns out well.
4. Allow yourself to feel whatever negative feelings you are feeling and let them go. You are getting to a better place in your life, that stuff is the last of how things used to be

This last part may be hard but having been there I need to say it- if things don't work out in time for what you are attempting, believe and know that you are moving toward bigger and better things. A lot of events in my life that were not exactly what I wanted led to the things that I could not have believed possible at the time.

EIYPO EXPLAINED

The cosmos is memory-mapped to your consciousness. Within your immediate awareness, there's your conscious mind. Being this close, you think this is who you are. As you get farther away from your immediate awareness, the world is a map of your subconscious. Being somewhat separate and delayed, you think these are other things.
Likewise, you are part of the map of everyone else's subconscious. It's all the same data, simply accessed and perceived differently. Like a memory map in a computer.
What is called "subconscious" or "conscious" mind is always relative on the observer.
>but if i'm reflecting someone else's subconscious, where's my free will??
You are the observer within. You are free to affect things using imagination and feeling. Your conscious and subconscious minds (which are in reality a continuum and not discrete or separate) are not really "you". The "you" with free will is that observer within who wields your wonderful human imagination.

Two things:
>Thesis Spiral
A long post generated by a short prompt will sound like somebody just repeating their thesis over and over and over.
>Total Confidence
This one can be a little trickier and less reliable, but the bot won't express doubts about the thesis unless reminded. Tricky because a lot of people online seem to keep their doubts to themselves anyway.

Also, don't trust typos etc. to show you the difference. Very easy to tell chatgpt "take that last output and introduce spelling errors and poor grammar." Many examples of this in previous threads.

>>33949361
There are several ways to identify bots on the internet. One common method is to look for patterns in behavior, such as repetitive or automated actions. For example, bots may post the same message multiple times, or they may follow a large number of accounts at once.

Another way to identify bots is to look at their profiles or accounts. Bots may have little or no personal information, or they may use generic profile pictures or bios. Additionally, bots may have a large number of followers or posts, but very few interactions or engagement.

You can also use tools that specifically detect bots, such as Botometer (formerly BotOrNot) which uses a variety of heuristics to determine the likelihood that an account is a bot.

It's worth noting that, as bots become more sophisticated and human-like, it can be harder to distinguish them from real users. In these cases, it can be helpful to consult with experts in the field, such as data scientists or social media analysts, for a more accurate assessment.

Ultimately, your intuition is a good starting point, but it's important to be aware of the different methods and tools available to help identify bots online.

Some of these small ones may be hidden from prying eyes if they are located in an area where they are covered by hills, enveloped by a bubble of rock on top caused by a cataclysmic event, or inside mountains and preserved within the mountain itself, but also in or rather under forests.

These small cities may not have been seen before due to their size, but there is potential for them to hold many secrets about our pasts that we never knew existed until now. It's exciting when you think about it, imagine discovering something new just because it was tucked away deep within a forest, in hills like the Chinese tombs, or inside caves, all things which were previously thought impossible to exist because
>muh tech scanna

The fact that we can scan the Earth with satellites and lidar does not imply that what is under the ground is visible. Many people never want to leave their homes' comfort, let alone venture into remote areas such as the Amazonian Forest, where no rivers flow. Even tribes living in these distant locations are usually found by water sources.

This means that there could be a lot of hidden treasures lying beneath our feet literal treasure troves waiting to be discovered. Humans almost never know about all of them until someone takes a chance and goes out into uncharted territory, but it doesn’t hurt to dream about what might lie beneath us if only we had better technology or more adventurous explorers willing to take risks for discovery.

The world has so much left undiscovered it just takes courage (and maybe some luck) for someone brave enough to set out on an adventure in search of something new and unknown. Who knows? Maybe you will uncover something amazing after all, you never know unless you try

So after all those threads about meditation I realized that I was meditating wrong all these years.
I was sitting in order to obtain powers and "change" myself but in reality all I was doing was trying to escape what I perceived as a "bad life sittuation", my thinking mind was holding the wheel.

Thanks to all of you I now know that the meditative state is one and only and it's the complete surrender in this momment here now and observing it without daydreaming about it.

And you can apply this to any activity.
An anon in one of these threads said that meditation for him goes like this: "notice, and then notice that you weren't noticing".

I'm sure that focusing on an object like the breath can also help someone distance himself from his mind and realize that his thoughts are not him but for me just being attentive works better.

In the first days of meditating like this my mind was thinking "Nooo I have to chase and achieve things! I can't just let go! Otherwise nothing will happen!" but those were just thoughts.
So yeah, just sit in silence and surrender, and the strange thing is that unique states of consciousness WILL come and happen when you don't strive to achieve!
I thinkg it's those jhanas people talk about, I never really experienced them in the past because I was probably just living in my head during meditation but now that I know how to let go they just come naturally.

Meditation thread! Let's go!

You don't need to look any further, your own personal next step into this journey you are living is right here in front of you, meditate on this moment here and now, if you feel like it sit in the dark and just be aware.

Realize that your thoughts are NOT you, they are part of you and you can choose to not give them much attention if you like or you may want to find where they came from.

Realize that there is nowhere to go and nothing to achieve because everything is already here in front of you, you are already perfect and you can enjoy the FEELING of being here, the feeling of experiencing this momment.

Some people like focusing on their breath, this is a good tool to reduce your thinking mind a bit but remember that focusing is not "thinking about my breath" but just feeling/hearing/sensing your breath while it enters and leaves your body.

That's all you need. Do it daily, everywhere, even when you walk or when you work. Take the seat of the observer because that's what you are: The eternal observer.

>>33939227
(same anon)
Let me add one thing before I go to bed: That most people nowadays tend to practice escapism a lot, and they think that that's what life should be about: ignoring the negatives and chasing the positive. Many people don't even realize that they practice escapism and they think that all this searching they are doing is what will "finally get them to the point they are searching for".

Many of the times in which you sit to mediate all those horrible thoughts and feelings will come and you will want to escape from them, I advice you to not try that, I advice you that you just sit there and be and realize that they are nothing more than illusions and that this need to escape them is also an illusion.
At the same time be sure you don't fall into the other side of the trap which sounds something like this: "Ok! I will sit and endure all those horrible things because that's what REAL meditation is about!" - for that is also an illusion.
See how dualism is an illusion?

So just be, just be here in your life, be so hard and let go so much that you literally dive into this thing you are trying to escape from.
Yes, fears will pop up, bad feelings may pop up, maybe some old forgotten uncomfortable memories will pop up, your mind will think thoughts like "Oh no I'm going crazy, maybe I'm meditating wrong and I'm frying my brain", blissful states will pop up, ecstasy will pop up, some succubus may pop up and ask for intercourse with you. Don't cling on any of them, just be aware, always take a step back at everything you see.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33934756
You're probably just doing it wrong / approaching it in a way that's not suited to your personal psychology. I'm hyper analytical and critical by nature. I learned meditation through the Goenka retreats where they teach a body scanning technique that allows you to tap deeper into your bodily feeling sense (kinesthetic sense) to the point that you start to see how this interacts with other layers that we would usually describe as psychological (i.e. thought) or feeling (i.e. emotional). I practiced very hard for a couple years a learned a bunch but ultimately it was not well suited for my psychology. The technique gave me to much to do. I think some people might benefit from a task oriented meditation like that but for my psychology it just provided too much opportunity to distract and obstruct myself through analysis. I eventually settled into a more "do nothing" style practice and I feel that I've advanced much farther and faster since then. You might find the same or the opposite.

1/2

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33948059
>>33934756
Anyway, if you're getting exhausted while meditating you're trying too hard. In the "do nothing" style of meditation I and many other anons are advocating in this thread, there's no trying. You relax your body, that's the first level of doing nothing - do nothing with your body - relax all the muscles.

Then your attention goes to the next layer of things you're doing - thoughts. So you stop doing those. But here is where I think a lot of people get hung up. In my experience you can't really stop thoughts or have the mind become completely blank as some describe it (or maybe you can if you're way more advanced than I am), but you can realize that you are not your thoughts - the thoughts keep churning away, appearing, changing, running their course, in your mind, but you are separate from that. Just as you can passively watch the ocean waves without have to somehow STOP the waves which is impossible, you just passively allow the thoughts to do their thing and soon you'll come to a place of awareness that is separate and more fundamental than the layer on which thoughts are happening.

You continue going on like this - noticing what is the next subtlest layer of things you're doing, and stopping doing them, or at least stopping identifying with them / being involved in them. Progressively, a deeper and deeper relaxation and clarity develops.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33951464
I'm having trouble answering the question despite trying several times!
My practice is simple, but I was helped by every step I've made along my journey, aided by my own natural proclivities. In acknowledging this, I acknowledge that what may have been an important step or critical tool for my journey may be the opposite for you.
The heart of my practice is to destroy all that is false, and this starts with realizing you, and everyone around you, has a voice in their head that they listen to. In fact, most people believe they ARE this voice. Early on, I found Isha Kriya to be useful in helping me create just a small bit of distance between my body/mind and my eternal awareness.
The only weapon in truth discernment is awareness. I'm not trying to be clever, I am being honest that only your awareness is faster, smarter, and stronger than your mind. In all other ways, mind is faster, stronger, it knows your weak points, it can pre-empt any attempt to get ahead of it. But awareness precedes all thought. Thought is encompassed by awareness.
Since the mind is always trying to generate some illusion or falsehood, the practice of watching the mind is something you can do all day, every day.
"Oh, there it goes again, telling that story about how worthless I am."
"Oh wow, look at my mind go, making up stories about why I feel what I feel. It's really on the loose now!"
Awareness is the weapon, so every time you see your mind making things up, you are aware that it is only making things up, not discerning truth. Every time you catch your mind, you take energy away from it, you kill it. "See the thing, kill the thing, clean up the mess."
This is an endless process and there is never a time you must stop. You can observe your mind while you are sitting still and breathing (we usually can this meditation). You can observe your mind while you are having a conversation with a friend.
In the end, after awareness takes away enough power from the mind, it becomes an ally.

>I have found it impossible to turn off my inner monologue
I can't turn off my inner monologue either. What I did was stare at the thing without fear long enough that I realized it had no bite and was all bark. My mind would love to give me the juiciest, most lurid, most scary, most provacative thoughts to think in the hopes I put all my attention into that thought. But I can let the mind spin its stories and be attached to none of them. In, out, another breath, one breath at a time.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
There are the colors that are connected to the specific wavelengths of light.

Then there are the colors that are connected to the perception of two (or more, I guess) different wavelengths of light being reflected off the same surface.

Reds and blues are on opposite ends of the spectrum, in between them on the spectrum are yellows and greens. But if reds and blues are being reflected by the same surface, your perception is not that the color is a yellow or green, but that it is a violet or magenta.

Honestly the television and computer display has ruined peoples imagination about color. Watching YouTube videos about weird colors isn't good enough, because it's only being displayed from a screen that can only create a limited number of defined colors.

There is hope for a radical color revolution though. 3D tv or cinema technology could be used to overlap different colors so they will be perceived simultaneously, creating an effect not seen in legacy displays. May cause seizures I guess.

Twisting and writhing like a snake on fiery sands,
Kneading her breast against her corset's metal bands,
The woman, meanwhile, from her mouth of strawberry
Let flow these fragrant words of musky mystery:
'I have the moistest lip, and well 1 know the skill
Within a bed's soft heart, to lose the moral will.
I dry up all your tears on my triumphant bust
And make the old ones laugh like children, in their lust.
I take the place for those who see my naked arts
Of moon and of the sun and all the other stars.
I am, my dear savant, so studied in my charms
That when I stifle men within my ardent arms
Or when I give my breast to their excited bites,
Shy or unrestrained, of passionate delight,
On all those mattresses that swoon in ecstasy
Even helpless angels damn themselves for me!'

When she had drained the marrow out of all my bones,
When I turned listlessly amid my languid moans,
To give a kiss of love, no thing was with me but
A greasy leather flask that overflowed with pus!
Frozen with terror, then, I clenched both of my eyes;
When I reopened them into the living light
I saw I was beside no vampire mannequin
That lived by having sucked the blood out of my skin,
But bits of skeleton, some rattling remains
That spoke out with the clacking of a weather vane,
Or of a hanging shop sign, on an iron spike,
Swung roughly by the wind on gusty winter nights.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Carnivorediet can't run edition

Intestinal control of Candida

Ketones altering the killing of Candida by neutrophils is irrelevant in controlling intestinal Candida overgrowth.
As for Candida using ketones for energy in the GI tract, you mentioned the TCA cycle. But this requires oxygen, which is pretty scarce in the intestines. This recent report suggests that dysbiosis may involve a shift to higher O2 levels. Perhaps this is something to explore, but otherwise, I don’t see adequate O2 levels for aerobic respiration via the TCA cycle.
Systemic control of Candida (tissue or blood infections)

These are the highlights from the Saeed paper you cited (Production of Pyruvate by Candida albicans: Proposed Role in Virulence) :

Focuses on the role of myeloperoxidase (MPO), the enzyme that helps neutrophils (phagocytic white blood cells) kill Candida (in tissue, not the gut).
MPO is inhibited by acetoacetate, one of the ketone bodies increased during ketosis.
It is suggested that prolonged ketosis may be a risk factor for (systemic) Candidiasis because Candida albicans can produce lots of pyruvate, a metabolite that may be converted to acetoacetate.
Conclusion

It has not been proven that Candida’s ability to use ketones efficiently for fuel in the GI tract. I will rethink this if increased GI oxygen levels (in dysbiosis?) needed to support the TCA cycle can be proven. Both ketones and glucose appear to repress cellular immunity to Candida. Other research suggests that increased blood glucose levels alone can induce a Candida protein which helps Candida evade the immune response regardless of ketone concentrations. I am not convinced that ketones per se are the only potential mechanism to help Candida evade the immune response.

natural alkaloid huperzine A (Fig. 44) is originated from the firmoss Huperzia serrata, and can be synthesized as well. >>33954295

I will give you a scenario to illustrate.

1) When someone wrongs you improperly, there are several components taking hold :

- one is the personal / intimate - "I was personally victimized"
- the second one is the impersonal / higher - "an injustice has occurred"

In such a scenario you can pursue righteous conduct and utilize the ego energy to a proper end.


2) When someone "wrongs" you properly - as in you are "wronged" but you deserve it, the components are such :

- one is the personal / intimate "I was personally victimized"
- the second one is the impersonal / higher "this was deserved"

The personal force in this case would be improper to pursue. It is this personal force that animates people in heated situations even if no injustice occurred, if you can direct and employ this energy - you are exercising good conduct and the higher you prevails.

All this is to say that you do not need to "kill" it as this force is embedded within you for a reason, it is how you use the tool that determines judgement.

>Five of Pentacles, Two of Wands, Queen of Swords, Tower, Judgement (R), Ace of Cups, Five of Cups, Hermit, Queen of Pentacles


It seems like in the past you used to be more consciously selective on whom you used to pursue, more critical perhaps and now you seem more inclined to leave emotions take a more leading role. You might have not yet fully transitioned to this mentality but it's portrayed as a step in the right direction that you will take. As to what distinguishes them, they will be very different from you and what you used to date, she would be someone that can challenge your points of view in life, not in an aggressive manner but more by showing you that some aspects of life that you don't partake on are actually interesting. This implies that she isn't someone from your usual circles so you might want to look further whenever you find yourself in environments that doesn't seem your type. You might also want look for someone that is a bit more mature and self centered, there is a theme in the reading of you managing to learn from them so this might reinforce the idea in the sense that you ought to tone it down when how much of a leading role you'll need. As a male myself I know how counterintuitive this might seem so I reckon it refers to someone that already have their own life and you get there to enjoy it with them, not trying to make one for them.

Queen of Pentacles is an interesting card in advice as one of the steps you could try start implementing is turning your lifestyle into something more sophisticated and taking care of yourself. So maybe you might need to separate a bit from what your hobbies or usual environments but don't think so as entirely, just make a point of dressing better and going to "better" types of buisnesses in the snobby sense, even mundane things like higher end supermarkets, if you go to the gym maybe a more luxurious one. I am just naming random examples to provide an idea of what I mean by sophistication.

I want to give you some advice but seeing as I carry a similar weight than you, I better just leave it to the cards.


>King of Wands (R), Knight of Swords (R), Two of Swords, Moon, Ten of Wands, Three of Pentacles

This spread is really simple yet there's so much I can say about it. So I don't think one last letter would help much because the issue doesn't lie on what they might say or do about it, it's not on them regardless of how much they played for the situation, what you want to heal is yourself, not them. So the cards advice just necessary contact if none is necessary then none at all, though there might be places that you frequent or things that you still have to do so disappearing isn't exactly mandatory. There are two ways we tend to brute force these things, either we try to cause a reaction in the other person or yourself or we just push things through the pain and try to just move things forward in our own corner of the world. The cards seem to recommend the later approach.
In your state right now you are trying to project your emotions into things in order to make sense of how you feel, in reality you don't need a justification to feel the way you do. Whether they behaved good or bad or whether you did, it's up to you to pick up the pieces of your heart so you can move on. They won't help or seeing them react in a certain way won't bring you clarity.

If you do intend to try to "fix" things, do so with a mentality of friendship and what thay brought or would bring to your life. >Two of Cups (R), Knight of Swords, Lovers, Wheel of Fortune, Two of Pentacles (R), King of Wands

Quite the contrast we find here. It seems that the keyissue here is lack of emotional balance in between them, particularly on how you apply your focus, things might seem so pressing in your mind that you aren't sure on which to tackle. So here is where we find the contrast, your issue is how many things you want to balance at the same time and overthinking but by doing so you are ironically showing less commitment to each of them. In Spanish we have a saying "el que mucho abarca, poco aprieta" which sorta translates to "the wider your embrace, the weaker your grip" or something like that. Meaning that wanting to do a lot can be less efficient than focusing on little by little. Try to narrow your sights focusing entirely on one thing at the time. Remind yourself why it is important and fully commit emotionally to one task at the time. See it as if every step is your lover that you desire nothing more than fulfilling them so your focus is entirely on them.

I've made a diet in the past that made me lose 26kg in one month. It was gruesome, nearly killed myself but it was succesful.
Anyway, flee from diets that involve too much weight loss in a toos hort amount of time, it's terribe to the body and can affect your gallbladder terribly (i've lost mine because of it).

Also, stay far away from "pre historic diets" or any high meat consuming diets, a friend of mine nearly lost her kidney because one of those.

Short tips:
- stop eating after 7pm, your whole metaboslim decreases, and with short or no exercises, all calories will be unspent. The ideal is more heavy foods early in the day, a stable lunch and a simple fruit or snack before night. Tea is great for battling night hunger, buddhist monks always do some.
- Lemon have a substance that is very good on fat burning, especially in the skin. but beware taking while fasting, it attacks the stomach. Do a shake with the whole lemon without any sugar before eating your breakfast or lunch.
(the flavor is not good, bitter to a fault, take it as a medicine).

It's not exactly what I was looking for but you seem earnest so here you go.

4 card spread
The Emperor (rev); Queen of Swords; Queen of Pentacles (rev); Death (rev)

The Emperor on his throne sits alone and apart from the court. Upturned we must question his judgement, stubbornness and an unwillingness to hear the voices of others are qualities that may make a great leader, but they will create distance from others. A wise and mature leader will heed counsel without feeling as if his throne is threatened. As a cautionary tale we see the Queen of Swords, sitting stern and alone. Do not flee to security of solitude, for although you may feel it arms you against the cruelty of the world it will only further your discontent. As if in retort we find our selves drawn to the apprehensive and contemplative Queen of Pentacles. Gazing at the treasure in her lap as if it were an egg about to hatch something unknown. If we are to find new beginnings we must embrace the fear and apprehension that are its eternal bedfellows. As a final caution, we find in Death reversed a stagnant future yet unwritten. Embrace change or find yourself forever mired in the troubles of the present.

All in all this reading smacks of the hedgehog's dilemma. If you embrace the apprehension of taking the initiative to reach out for human connection I am sure more good things will find you.

>Eat as varied as possible (organ meats, vegetables, fruits, dairy, fish, shellfish, properly prepared whole grains, legumes, nuts and seeds, etc.).

>You can lose fat (not the same as losing weight) and gain muscle at the same time.

>Is there more to the world than meets the eye?
The most basic jump-off point for any anon should be the fact that other animals can see different colors, i.e. things humans only recently developed technology to see (ultraviolet, infrared). Not only that, but animals have senses today the environment that, for some reasons, humans just ignore or harness in technology (birds sense magnetism, sharks sense electricity; we use magnets, and we have recently domesticated electricity). Physics and science does a good job to explain “how,” while philosophy endeavors to explain “why.” But while we’re thing to find out the rules of nature, we’re being subjected to these forces on a daily basis; the most prominent being the collective unconscious, which doesn’t even have a representation in the physical world. Sounds can be perceived within a certain range, but when they emulate the sound of a human voice, they get your brain to think about imaginary pictures and concepts, some of which are loaded with connotations and meanings- and these are all supplied to you from experience and evolution. There’s no other world than what you can perceive, but there’s channels and layers of this world that you cannot perceive: fourth dimensions and higher, for example. The ability to question these things is also what prevents you from finding the answer; just as thought and consciousness is recursive, so is asking “why.” Humans can really only perceive the past, and the “present” is an infinitesimal point that we always miss, because it’s so incalculably small- it may as well not exist. So, not only is your perception of space distorted by your corporeal body, but so is your sense of time distorted by your incorporeal mind.
That is why the tree of knowledge had the forbidden fruit, because wisdom is knowing how much you don’t know. It also causes you to be self aware (a recursion within the psyche), and that physically manifests as shame and ego.

The One Ring is literally not of this world and the closest Mythology is Odin and his quest to retake his Ring. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Draupnirtheir) Sauron and the Wizards are 2nd tier angels, (Maiar). In the 1st Age of Arda Melchor, a Higher Angel (Valar), decided to defy Eru Illuvatar, the Creator of Arda. He brought Sauron into his circle and he became the lesser of two Evils. Sauron was a Master Craftsman and he used his angelic powers to create the magic rings as "gifts" to the Elves, Dwarves, and Men as an act of repentance, but had no intention of stopping and went back to his allegiance to Melchor. He taught an Elf how to create them, then he secretly created The One Ring that controlled all the others, and put much of his angelic soul into the Ring. He was responsible for the corruption of Númenor (Atlantis) and its destruction by Eru. Sauron saw the Elves as a Problem because of their skepticism about their rings and they warred against him along with Dwarves and men in the 2nd Age. A human king was able to cut it off Sauron's finger, so he was diminished and retreated to a fortress city for a long time, and the 3rd Age began.
Yes, magick is real, but it can't usually do the physical things that people want it to do. Yes, there are more things to the World than meets the eye, but most people don't run into them very often so they dismiss them as fantasy. IMHO, they are not.

>>33953846
>Bind and force method is bad
Sure. If that's how you see it, it will turn out poorly. I've had a much smoother go since incorporating the shem hamephorash into my goetic workings. It's how the system was designed. If you see things in a confrontational light, that will distort your workings, probably not to your benefit. Helps to see the shem angels as helping to translate your will and guide your energies during the rite, rather than forcing the daemon to do what you want.
>ask respectfully
yes, OP if you phrase it something like this, you're in for a better time: "By the power of El, IAO, [relevant shem angels], I call upon thee, [daemon name]. I ask that you go forth and bring me X."
>where original sources?
OP, if you want, grab henry archer's magick of angels and demons. He goes into a pretty good review of source material used in contemporary goetia and that should give you a starting point as to whether you want to go into the sloane rabbit hole.
>What's up with the listed powers?
You've got to read into those and try to understand the nature of those powers and the ontology of those who made the system back in the day. Invisibility is a way to be unobserved. Back then, that meant literal invisibility. Maybe that's possible, I don't know, kind of extreme. But in another sense, that means you can be unobserved while undertaking activity, which is very useful. For example, if I'm making a new product, and there's a low barrier to entry, and I feel like someone is going to try to snake my idea before I have a chance to release it, then I want to be able to work unobserved, in which case the power may be of use. Don't be too literal about things, see how the energy might fit the situation at hand.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I had a good friend that made it. He was part of our 'burn' group (basically little burning man's except there weren't any vendors, no body traded shit, and everyone was expected to support themselves (radical self reliance))
We did it often, normally. I enjoyed the fractals and the feeling it gave me of being one with nature.
At a burn I met another person that made it. I had a small amount with me and we smoked. He asked if I had ever seen 'the it/them' (this was before people said 'break through') I said no, and he said you will tonight.
I smoked so much dmt that night, all of mine, most of his. Maybe it was because I had a tolerance from smoking casually for so long, but once it hit it hit.
We were smoking on the tall wooden structure that would be burned the next day. I felt my perception rising higher and higher and higher until I wasn't just above the field we were in, I was above our dimension.
It sounds stupid to repeat, but I genuinely felt my head 'pop' through a barrier, but only my head. I looked around and saw two entities sitting beside each other. I can't call them clockwork per say, but they were definitely made of the same fractuals I had seen before. They were surprised to see me. I felt like I was interrupting a picnic. But they both looked(?) at me and all I felt was their amusement, as if I was a toddler, 'what do you think you're doing, you cute little rascal?' was everything I felt. Then one gently pushed me back down and my perception floated all the way back to my body again.

That was probably the 100th, but also the last time, I did dmt. The only thing that ever came close to feeling that real was the one time I did Salvia, and waaay too much of it, but it was still surprisingly pleasant.

These are the most realistic takes in this thread. The biggest thing with DMT is
>hype
>hype
>hype
It's a hallucinogenic drug. You will be fucked up. See shit. Hear shit. Imagine shit and perceive shit through other unknown senses. But it's a hallucination. It's not real. You're high. The guy who first hooked me up with some described it as "acid crack" i.e. highly concentrated and very intense but with a short duration. And that's just what it was like. After 15 or 20 minutes that was enough. It was like a 12-16 hour acid trip worth in my mind. If you've never done any hallucinogenic drugs, or any kind of drugs for that matter, yeah I could see how maybe you'd think you were talking to aliens or angels or some shit. But you're not. You're just high.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I had some subthreshold trips in my room a couple of years back
In one of them, the open-eye world was all made of perspectives. Like here "I" was with my own view, and then everything in the room also had its own view, in fact, that was its nature and substance, was that it was aware.

Then when I closed my eyes I could see a beautiful blue baby being formed inside my mind, because I was thinking of having a baby with my gf. There was no gender yet, but just a pervasive feeling of care, attention and cuteness, like I just wanted to be a parent and be kind and gentle. How is babby formed? Just take DMT and find out, I guess.

In another one, I looked at Metatron's Cube on this mandala https://subtle.energy/metatrons-cube/ and it felt like Metatron looked at me from behind. Like here "I" was, with my perspectives, and then way beyond that there was an infinity of understanding sort of underlying that which tied into the subconscious and unconscious mind, and then way beyond that was the divine realms where El Shaddai kept watch, and, for just a moment, was aware of me. It was so unbelievably cool and I feel blessed to have had the experience and to share it. He was just this vast consciousness that exists within and beyond all things. So the patterns on the surface of the image I was looking at were accelerated and deepened and very beautiful, but what was really going on was like this deep understanding that the angelic realms are connected with and interpenetrate our own on a continuous basis, always available, always present.

I don't regret not taking more. It was right for what it was, and it was my fav so far. I also looked at picrel, imagined dots inside the circles and little lines inside the bars, and imagined that doing this "picked up" some energy. Then I looked back at the subtle energy mandala and it felt like the whole chunk of energy was placed there, with an enormous THUD that felt extremely pleasurable, as though this is what reality is made for.

How do I get rid of self defeating thoughts?

posts.name: WERDS4
posts.com:
>>33948062
The answer is simple, the path is slightly more difficult. I'll give you a structure of principles and then possibly an example.

First thing, understand that the more you practice something, the stronger it gets. It's like weight training. The more you do it the better you get at it. If you keep up with the self defeating thoughts you will get good at that.

To remove anything we dislike, you need to change a few environmental things to support you. Think of it as building a new habit or thought pattern of no self defeating thoughts.

once you practice an engrain that into your system then the self defeating thoughts will wither like an unused muscle.

A couple ways is change 1 aspect of your routine and implement a new habit with it. For example eat a different breakfast than usual, or at a different time, and carry a pocket journal with you.

Every time you have a self defeating thought notice it and jot down that you had one in the journal with the date and time.

When you start to notice them, then you can start to see patterns and then change those patterns. if anything triggers them. then remove the triggers. If they pop up spontaneously change what you are doing and think of something positive about yourself (your alive and breathing for example)

meditation helps to notice these things that we simply do. so consider that.

TL;DR
change one routine you have, carry an implement you don't typically like a pocket journal. notice when you have those thoughts and change them to a positive thought. meditate .

If you want visualizations specifically, pick an object, start simple, look at the object all over for a bit then and place it in front of you. Then close your eyes and imagine the same object. Rotate it in your mind's eye (imagination). Eventually over time add more detail (shading, depth background, time of day etc)
OR
start with a simple shape like a blue circle and hold that image. Then overtime add more. Make it a sphere and rotate it. or a cylinder shape and rotate it. Make it translucent and add another object inside it like a pyramid. Rotate them together, rotate them independently and so on.

If you want a simple daily practice instead (not visual) sit on a chair knees lower than hips. Hands on your knees (keep your knees and legs together for the whole practice) breath into your belly through your nose for a count of 6 seconds and exhale for a count of 6 seconds.

posts.name: WERDS4
posts.com:
>>33948349
Most of us could, we can still get back it just takes time to clear all the gunk that is in the way.
It sounds boring but the foundational work is key.
Sit quietly on a chair, knees below your hips, hands on your knees and breathing in and out the nose. inhale 6 seconds, exhale 6 seconds. Do this everyday. I say aim for 30 mins to 60 mins.
This will start clearing out the gunk. It's like clogged piping. we only get a trickle. If you want to have the full water pressure, you need to remove all the sticky gunk and that takes some time. This is the starting place.
If you want faster results, consider a moving meditation since that is much more powerful (but harder).
